>
[Martyr's Shield](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3126)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=683" />
<trait label="No Alignment" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Divine" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=579" />
<trait label="Intelligent" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=636" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 305 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Base Shield** [Steel Shield](/Shields.aspx?ID=19)
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Perception** +12; precise vision 30 feet, imprecise hearing 30 feet

**Communication** speech ([Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1) and [Empyrean](/Languages.aspx?ID=115))

**Skills** [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +15, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +13

**Int** +0, **Wis** +2, **Cha** +4

**Will** +15 

</column>

---        

_A martyr's shield_ is a [_lesser sturdy shield_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=327) imbued with the compassion of a devout champion of a righteous deity, like [Iomedae](/Deities.aspx?ID=9) or [Vildeis](/Deities.aspx?ID=130), who sacrificed themself to save an ally. In addition to good-naturedly attempting to convert you to its religion, the _martyr's shield_ can use 1 reaction each round that, when raised, it uses to [Shield Block](/Feats.aspx?ID=839) to protect an ally adjacent to you. This follows the rules for Shield Block, but protects your ally instead. The _martyr's shield_ uses this reaction whether you would prefer it did so or not. The _martyr's shield_ can be upgraded to a stronger form of _sturdy shield_ by paying the difference in cost between its current type of _sturdy shield_ and the new type.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
